description: '''Maskandi''' (also '''Maskanda''') is a form of [[Zulu music|Zulu]] [[folk music]], originally associated with migrant workers,  that is evolving with [[South Africa]]n society. Thought to be pioneered by [[Phuzushukela]] (John Bhengu). Often characterised by a picking guitar style which draws on a variety of historical influences it also has an important social function with players being given sanction to publicly criticise powerful people.
